column2: Questions and Answers with Dharma Realm Buddhist University

A small group from the Dharma Realm Buddhist University (DRBU) located at the City of Ten Thousand Buddhas (CTTB) spent the morning at Abhayagiri. The group included two bhikkshunis as well as a number of resident volunteers at the CTTB. The students are in DRBU’s Masters of Arts in Buddhist Classics program. This semester the students have been reading various spiritual biographies including the biographies of the Thai Forest masters Ajahn Mun, Ajahn Tate and Ajahn Lee Dhammadharo. The audio is from their question and answer session with Ajahn Pasanno.

column6: Session title

column3: 2014-11-18 Questions & Answers With the Dharma Realm Buddhist University.mp3

column6: Text
What is Abhayagiri's daily schedule?
[Ajahn Lee's biography](Ajahn Lee Biography) contrasts the lives of city and forest monks. Is the lifesytle here (Abhayagiri) similar to the dhutaṅga monks?
What are the connotations of "dhutaṅga monk?" Is it a slur?
Ajahn Ñāṇiko's tudong up the California coast.
"[Circles of Blessing: Our Redwood Tudong](https://www.abhayagiri.org/talks/6254-circles-of-blessing-our-redwood-tudong)"
Did they (Ajahn Ñāṇiko and Tan Pamutto) have backpacking gear?
The two-month tudong to Pacific Hermitage
So it's pretty rare to get food every day when you're on a walk?
Do you have to educate the local people about almsround when you go on tudong?
How does tudong help you on the spiritual path?
DRBU2014_S00_F09.mp3
Is there a requirement for monks in the Forest Tradition to walk tudong?
DRBU2014_S00_F10.mp3
Ajahn Chah tells a monk to pack his gear and walk tudong within Wat Pah Pong.
Ajahn Chah lets a restless three-Vassa Western monk go tudong.
Can bhikkhshunis walk tudong?
What is the ordination process of someone who wants to become a monk?
Is the decision to ordain a novice by democratic vote?
What happens after five years?
How often does the community reject someone who wants to go forth?
May I ask for your secret? [Why is Abhayagiri monastic training so often successful?]
Do American monks have a culture shock when they visit Thailand?
How do we take refuge in awareness (Buddho) in daily life?
MN 10: Satipaṭṭhāna Sutta
In the answer to this question, Ajahn Pasanno equates awareness with mindfulness.
The literal meaning of Buddho is 'the one who knows,' but it's also being the one who knows, where you have the opportunity for us to be that knowing.
So being the one who knows, you don't have to react to dislike and like?

The difference between an awakened mind and an unawakened mind is that the unawakened mind keeps following likes and dislikes. An awakened mind can see that arise, establish itself, and pass away. The mind is the same.
So why can awareness be the place where we take refuge?
How do you not objectify this awareness?
If you objectify awareness, you're going to suffer.
These Four Noble Truths are not an endpoint, they are something that you're internalizing and using in your meditation practice and in your daily life.
The values of the Thai Forest Tradition.
Pay attention to the difference between the mind and the objects of mind.|Ajahn Mun
Is the peaceful mind your home?
[Ajahn Mun's biography](Ajahn Mun Biography) describes a constant fierce vigilance, watching the mind. But meeting you guys, you're so peaceful and calm. How does this work in terms of practice?
Any great teacher is not monochromatic.
AN 4.243: "But Ānanda, when has Anuruddha ever concerned himself with disciplinary issues in the midst of the Saṅgha?"
So what about the Bodhisattva practice?
AN 4.17-20: Practice that benefits self, others, both or neither.
"What are the mind states of an enlightened being?" "Only compassion."|Ajahn Mahā Boowa
What are the practicalities of metta practice? How does it relate to compassion?
Ajahn Amaro writes about transforming the energy of sense contact into compassion and metta. How does this work?
What are the natural inclinations that can lead to well-being and peace?
The Buddha teaches to end suffering, but from the ordinary person's view, cultivating the practices of forest monks is also suffering. Who is right?
The teaching of the Buddha isn't about language....The teaching of the Buddha is the language of experience.|Ajahn Chah
